explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified into Category 3 since flash point 26 degC (closed-cup) (IUCLID (2000)) is >=23 degC and <=60 degC. The substance is classified into Class 3, PG III in UNRTDG (UN2245).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Auto-ignition point is 430 degC (Hommel (1996)) exceeding 70 degC.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: The substance is an organic compound containing oxygen which is chemically bonded only to carbon.

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on LD50 values of 1200 mg/kg and 2700 mg/kg for rats (JECFA (2003)), the lower value was adopted and the substance was classified into Category 4.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on a LD50 value of >5000 mg/kg for rabbits (IUCLID (2000)), the substance was classified as "Not classified".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data. As relevant information, although there is information of a LC50 value of 19,500 mg/m3 (5,668 ppmV) (RTECS (2006)), the exposure period is not clear. Since the LC50 value was lower than 90% of saturated vapour pressure concentration (15000 ppm), the test was considered to be conducted for vapour with almost no included mists.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on results of not irritating (skin primary irritation index (PII): 0.31) in a rabbit test (OECD TG404) (IUCLID (2000)) and slightly irritating (PII: 2.75 and 3.0) after application for 4-hour in other two rabbit tests (IUCLID (2000)), the substance was classified as "Not classified" in JIS Classification (correspond to Category 3 or "Not classified" in GHS classification). As relevant information, in EU classification, the substance is classified into Xi; R36/38 (EU-Annex I (access on July 2009)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on results of AOI 54.66 (24-hour) and "highly irritating" in a rabbit test (OECD TG405) (IUCLID (2000)), the substance was classified into Category 2A. As relevant information, in EU classification, the substance is classified into Xi; R36 (EU-Annex I (access on July 2009)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data. There is a report that the substance "produced no sensitization reactions" in a maximization test on 25 volunteers (IUCLID (2000)). This information is reported in a document in List 2 and the positive ratio or data for the control group is not clear.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data from in vivo mutagenicity tests. From in vitro mutagenicity tests, there is a report of a negative Ames Test (JECFA (2003)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In a rat developmental test by oral administration during organogenesis period, no maternal, embryo or fetal toxic effects were observed (JECFA (2003)). In a female mice test involving i.p. injections for 28 days, mating with untreated males on the day 10, there were no effects on fertility (JECFA (2003)). However, this information is incomplete as evidence for classification because of exposure to females only, one dosage and the small number of animals (8/group). Therefore, classification was not possible due to lack of data for sexual function and fertility.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.rationale: In inhalation tests with rats for 4 - 11 weeks or 11 - 16 weeks, effects on the mitral cells of the olfactory bulb or relationship between concentration of the test substance and drug metabolizing enzymes were reported (IUCLID (2000)). However, these tests are not standard, repeated exposure test, therefore information required for classification are not available because of few examination items. Classification was not possible due to lack of data.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Not classified from its 24h-EC50 = 1435 mg/L for Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (AQUIRE, 2010).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Not classified since it is not non-water soluble (water solubility: 9177 mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2009) and its acute toxicity is Not classified.
